intro: Angelica cryptotaeniifolia var. cryptotaeniifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic, medicinal properties. The species is valued for its unique botanical features and historical use in traditional medicine.
